Evos Hamburg GmbH through its subsidiary Evos Finance BV, has entered into an agreement to acquire 100% stake in four terminals located in Amsterdam, Terneuzen, Ghent and Malta, from 3i Infrastructure plc and Oiltanking GmbH. The acquisition will be funded through a capital increase at Evos by First Sentier and additional debt financing. Under the transaction, 3i Infrastructure will divest 45% stake and Oiltanking will divest 55% stake in four terminals, respectively. The Amsterdam and Terneuzen terminals have a tank capacity of 1,701,937 cbm and 511,187 cbm located in Netherlands. The Ghent terminal has a tank capacity of 899,473 cbm located in Belgium. The Malta terminals has a tank capacity of 568,380 cbm. The transaction is in line with Evos' vision and First Sentier´s long term infrastructure investment philosophy to create a tank storage platform with presence in the key European liquid bulk hubs. The transaction is subject to the applicable Dutch and Belgian employee consultation procedures.
